player: Thabo Sefolosha (groin) has been ruled out of Sunday's game vs. the Knicks.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play on Monday vs. the Clippers.
Rondae Hollis-Jefferson (sore right ankle) will play on Monday vs. the Heat.
Joe Harris (ankle) will not play Monday vs. the Heat.
The Nets announced that Jeremy Lin will miss another 3-5 weeks after aggravating his strained left hamstring.
Al Horford (groin) will start Monday vs. the Pistons.
Demetrius Jackson (illness) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Wizards.
Avery Bradley (Achilles) has been ruled out for Monday's game against the Pistons.
Cody Zeller (right quad) is being listed as doubtful for Tuesday's game against Portland.
Brian Roberts (illness) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Wizards.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) is probable to play Tuesday vs. Portland.
Taj Gibson (sore left ankle) is hopeful to play on Wednesday vs. the Thunder.
Kevin Love (back spasms) won't play vs. the Mavericks on Monday.
J.R. Smith hasn't done any cardio exercises since fracturing his thumb on Dec. 20, but hopes to receive clearance to begin working out at his doctor's appointment on Friday.
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) is questionable for Monday's game vs. the Cavaliers.
Deron Williams (toe) will not play on Monday vs. the Cavaliers.
J.J. Barea (left calf strain) is likely out until the All-Star break according to coach Rick Carlisle.
Jamal Murray (illness) did not practice on Monday.
Mike Malone said that Nikola Jokic (hip) has been rehabbing in the pool "quite a bit," but he's doubtful to play Tuesday vs. the Lakers.
Emmanuel Mudiay (back) will travel to Los Angeles and he is being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Lakers.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Stephen Curry (stomach flu) has been ruled out for Sunday's game against Portland.
David West (thumb) is ramping up his activity and will be reevaluated early next week.
Kevin Seraphin (knee) will not suit up for Sunday's game against the Rockets, but he doesn't expect the injury to be long-term.
Coach Nate McMillan said that Rodney Stuckey (hamstring, out Sunday) will "definitely" practice within the next two days, after which he'll be re-evaluated.
Chris Paul underwent successful surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his left thumb, and he's expected to miss the next 6-8 weeks of action.
Brice Johnson (back) is nearing a return according to coach Doc Rivers.
Julius Randle (pneumonia) did not practice on Monday.
D'Angelo Russell (calf, knee) went through a full practice on Monday, and he's been cleared to play for Tuesday's game against the Nuggets.
JaMychal Green (knee) is listed as questionable for Monday's game vs. the Suns.
Chandler Parsons (rest) will not play against the Jazz on Saturday night.
Deyonta Davis (foot) will not play on Saturday vs. the Jazz.
Brandan Wright (knee) is planning to make his regular-season debut Monday vs. Phoenix.
Tyler Johnson (shoulder) is expected to return from a five-game absence for Monday's game against the Nets.
Josh Richardson (foot) has "been able to do more" recently according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) has been aiming for a return near the All-Star break, according to C.F. Gardner of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Derrick Rose (ankle) has been ruled out of Sunday's game vs. the Hawks and is expected to miss additional time.
Lance Thomas (face) is still a week away from returning.
Enes Kanter (fractured right arm) had surgery on Friday and will be re-evaulated in about four weeks.
Aaron Gordon (sore right ankle) will play on Monday vs. the Wolves.
Jodie Meeks underwent surgery to correct his dislocated right thumb on Tuesday, and he will be out indefinitely.
Evan Fournier (foot) will come off the bench Monday vs. Minnesota.
Joel Embiid (left knee contusion) has been ruled out for Monday's game against the Kings.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
76ers' head coach Brett Brown said that Ben Simmons (foot) is still "a ways away" from being cleared for 5-on-5 work.
Dragan Bender (ankle) will not play against the Nuggets on Saturday.
Ed Davis (wrist) will not suit up for Tuesday's game against Charlotte.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Jonathan Simmons (wrist) is questionable to play Tuesday vs. the Thunder.
Pau Gasol (left hand) is undergoing surgery to repair the fracture of his fourth metacarpal.
Rudy Gay (Achilles) expects to be ready for training camp prior to the start of the 2017-18 season after undergoing successful surgery on his ruptured left Achilles’ tendon.
Omri Casspi (right calf) will miss at least one more week of action.
The Raptors have recalled Delon Wright and Bruno Caboclo from the D-League.
Derrick Favors was limited to non-contact work at Monday's practice.
Depending on upcoming test results, Ian Mahinmi could potentially return after the All-Star break.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated later this week to determine if he will be cleared for contact.
